snippet: After two health professionals tortured some C.I.A. detainees, Congress should enact legislation that explicitly prohibits medical personnel from direct involvement in interrogations.
abstract: Editorial contends that one of most disturbing revelations in Senate report on CIA's interrogation program is deep complicity of medical personnel, including psychologists James Mitchell and Bruce Jessen, in torture of suspected terrorists; calls for legislation or executive order that prohibits all forms of torture and bars health professionals from direct involvement in interrogations.
lead_paragraph: After two health professionals tortured some C.I.A. detainees, Congress should enact legislation that explicitly prohibits medical personnel from direct involvement in interrogations.
